title: Revolution reveal ‘Independence Day’ jersey
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution unveiled the 'Independence Day' jersey featuring a fireworks-themed pattern for the 2026-2027 MLS seasons.
Fans can purchase the new jersey at pop-up locations in Boston, including the Old State House and Ducali Pizzeria & Bar.
Revolution will start the 2026 MLS season against Nashville SC on February 21 at Geodis Park under new coach Marko Mitrović.

title: About a dozen vehicles damaged by a bridge joint on I-91 in Western Mass.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: About a dozen vehicles were damaged by a protruding bridge joint on I-91 in Western Massachusetts.
MassDOT crews cut down the raised bridge joint, and State Police assisted affected vehicles at the scene.
Drivers can file claims for personal injury up to $4,000 but not for property damage from roadway defects.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague argues judge is biased and should be removed
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Kelsey Fitzsimmons seeks Judge Kathleen McCarthy-Neyman's recusal, alleging bias in her shooting trial.
Fitzsimmons was shot by a fellow North Andover officer while being served a restraining order in June.
The recusal motion claims McCarthy-Neyman acted improperly and has a vested interest in town's financial reputation.

title: Eli Lilly snaps up Watertown biotech in $2.4 billion deal
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eli Lilly acquires Watertown-based Orna Therapeutics for $2.4 billion, incorporating immune cell engineering biotechnology.
Orna Therapeutics develops treatments using circular RNA to promote body-driven disease-fighting cell therapies.
Eli Lilly previously acquired Scorpion Therapeutics and Verve Therapeutics, totaling over $3.6 billion in acquisitions last year.

title: Boston man paroled after serving 16 years of life sentence for fatal stabbing outside bar
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Corey Patterson, convicted of a 2009 fatal stabbing in Allston, was granted parole after serving 16 years in prison.
Patterson, 38, was sentenced to life in 2012 for second-degree murder but was eligible for parole after educational and personal reforms.
His parole conditions include electronic monitoring, drug supervision, a curfew, and no contact with the victim's family.

title: ‘You’re going to feel the pain’: Kurt Warner’s advice to Drake Maye after losing Super Bowl LX
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Kurt Warner advises Patriots QB Drake Maye to process both success and failure after Super Bowl LX loss.
Patriots, under Mike Vrabel, reached the Super Bowl after improving from a 4-13 record to 14-3.
Seahawks defeated the Patriots 29-13, despite Maye's near-MVP season at age 23.

title: Making movies, like making sausages, is not pretty. Just ask John Sayles.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Oscar-nominated filmmaker John Sayles discusses his new novel 'Crucible' set in Detroit during the Henry Ford era.
Sayles, also a screenwriter, originally worked in an East Cambridge sausage factory and has a long-standing career in writing and film.
Sayles' past works include films like 'Matewan' and 'Lone Star'; he will make several Massachusetts appearances for his book tour.

title: Can you find your partner on a stoop in Southie? The creator of Boston’s ‘Stoop Dating’ thinks so.
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stoop Dating, created by Julz Radley, hosts blind dates on a Southie porch step to encourage face-to-face interaction.
The show has gained popularity, amassing 13,800 Instagram followers and 44,300 TikTok followers since its launch.
Episodes, sometimes filmed in locations like Nashville, involve fun questions and chemistry checks between matched singles.

title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, were arrested in Maine for the fatal shooting of Mike Jonas in Brockton.
Thompson faces a first-degree murder charge; Slade is charged as an accessory after the fact in Brockton District Court.
Jonas was fatally shot and stabbed in Finnegan Park on September 23, 2025; Thompson identified as the shooter.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels shortstop Zach Neto this offseason, as reported by MassLive.
Zach Neto has completed two consecutive 20-20 seasons with the Angels and remains under team control until 2029.
The Red Sox acquired infielder Caleb Durbin from the Brewers, opting not to meet Angels' high trade demands for Neto.
